fields.description:
###Summary\\
When mentions a username which has the word deadbeef such as @deadbeef or @deadbeef<Numbers> or @<Numbers>deadbeef or @dead<Numbers>beef

The mention name instead of redirect to the User Profile, it redirects to https://bitbucket.org/testusername/testrepository/commits/<mentioned_username>

###Steps to Reproduce

# Go to a commit or Pull Request
# Click comment
# Use '@' to mention username with the word 'deadbeef'
# Click preview

###Expected Results###\\
The link redirects to https://bitbucket.org/testusername/testrepository/commits/<mentioned_username>

###Actual Results###\\
The link redirects to https://bitbucket.org/<mentioned_username>

###Notes###\\
The mentioned name doesn't render the mentioned user full name either.\\
The comment render and display '@<deadbeef>' instead of '<User Full Name>'
fields.summary: Incorrect redirection link for mentioned users that has the name 'deadbeef' (BB-16149)

fields.description:
Hi,

[EDIT] Sorry I just noticed it may not be the right place to post this issue ...[/EDIT]

I looked in the issues but didn't find anything about  that, is there any support for the FIDO U2F concerning calls to the BitBucket API ? It seems that we can only do basic auth for the moment.

Is it supported ? If not, do you intend to ?

Cheers.
fields.summary: Add support for FIDO U2F for the API

fields.description:
I've deleted the following repository, but it shows in my dashboard.\\
And when I clicked it, I got "Oops, you've found a dead link." page.\\
https://bitbucket.org/prex-arbie/maruhi-passport
fields.summary: Dead link after repository is deleted.
Ability to use parent task branch as parent branch

fields.description: My browser tab spends most of the day on the Pull requests screen of Bitbucket since I need to approve new Pull requests. It would be nice if this screen auto-refreshed or at least notified me when the view was outdated similar to JIRA Boards.
fields.summary: Auto-refresh pull request list

fields.description:
Hi, I am currently getting a Error 500 response for a GET request to the below mentioned API call.

https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/account/repository/branches

It takes a while to get the response but throws Error 500. Is there a 2.0 version for the same API call which can be used instead of this?

Thanks
fields.summary: Internet Server Error 500/502 with API 1.0 to get branches

fields.description:
Hi. I have private repo, and activate wiki. I have admin rights and I can edit wiki.\\
But other user have write rights not can edit wiki. Users can write in all branches except default and develop.\\
I can not set write for default and develop, but want that users can edit wiki.

How users can edit wiki? Thanks.\\
!1914647320-879b5a5046.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot edit wiki pages

fields.description:
I want to have a database running so that my build can run tests which actually query from a live database (integration tests).

Conceptually, I'm trying to do something like:

image: mysql

pipelines:\\
default:\\
- step:\\
script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.\\
- "mysqld"\\
- "mysql -u root -e 'CREATE DATABASE databaseTestInstance'"

That should just pull the official mysql image down from dockerhub, start the database process, and create a default database that my test suite can connect to.

This, however, doesn't work.  Officially, it looks like the MySql team just built this image such that you can run it from your local box, via:

docker run --name app-container-name --link my-container-name:mysql -d app-that-uses-mysql

https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql/

I'm not sure how to port that logic to something Pipelines can understand.  To me, it seems like Pipelines just uses "image:mysql" to construct the docker run command.  So what I'd like to know is what to put in my .yml file such that I can pull a mysql server docker image down, start the mysql process, and connect to it such that I can create a default database.
fields.summary: Use MySql docker image for unit tests in Pipelines

fields.description: Provide a configuration area to allow build notifications to be pushed (e.g. send an email on failure to team)
fields.summary: Build notifications

fields.description:
I would like to run a single build multiple times against different base images. Eg. if I wanted to test against {{image: golang:1.6}} and {{image: golang:1.7}} to ensure my build and tests work against both versions of Go.

Maybe just allowing the image to be built per step:

{code}
image: golang:latest
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        image: golang:1.6
        script:
          - go version
    - step:
        image: golang:1.7
        script:
          - go version
{code}
fields.summary: Support for building against multiple base images

fields.description:
From issues such as BCLOUD-8995 and BCLOUD-12897, in which Bitbucket's issue tracker is falling behind that on Github, I can only assume that Atlassian is purposely withholding features from the issue tracker to try get us to use JIRA

Fine! I'll pay for JIRA. Make there some way so that I can pay extra and have _normal Bitbucket users_ access JIRA in my project, transparently, just as they currently do with the default issue tracker.

In other words, in my Bitbucket repository, alongside the "turn on issue tracker" checkbox, there would be an option: "plain old issue tracker that isn't as good as Github" or "JIRA issue tracker which you'll pay extra for". And I would pay extra for it!

As it stands, if I understand it correctly, if I want to use JIRA I'll have to set it up completely separately, add users independently, and it wouldn't be integrated in my normal Bitbucket project as the default issue tracker is.

If I misunderstand how this works, please correct my misunderstanding. Thanks.
fields.summary: Checkbox-enabled embedded JIRA.

fields.description:
In the Bitbucket issue tracker, if I add an issue reference from issue 123 to issue 456 using the {{#}} sign, a link to issue 456 is created in issue 123, as I would expect.

But when I go to issue 456, there is no indication _in issue 456_ that there are issues _linking to it_.

This is surprising, as this works fine in GitHub. In fact in GitHub I can even reference issues across repositories, and when I go to the target issue it shows that such and such issue referenced it.

People always ask me why I host my code on Bitbucket rather than Github. With issues like this and BCLOUD-8995 (which Atlassian has ignored for years), and more popping up every few days, I am starting to wonder why myself...
fields.summary: Recognize issue references to current issue in issue tracker.

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to only do a "build" when a) in named branches and/or b) in a pull request.

For example:

* Run pipelines on master branch
* Run pipleines on all pull requests
* Disable pipelines on all other branches
fields.summary: Pipelines for pull requests / disabling pipelines for branches

fields.description: During the initial configuration of a pipeline there is a lot of changes that need to be made to the configuration file, it would be nice if I could test the configuration without having to commit them.
fields.summary: Ability to test configuration before committing Pipelines YAML

fields.description: If I have a parent repo with pipelines enabled, then fork, then create a PR to merge something back from the fork into the parent repo, it should build the branch in the fork, without the fork having pipelines enabled. This is the normal behavior in travis and really useful: as the owner of the parent repo I want to make sure any PR I get from forks first gets build.
fields.summary: Trigger build in parent repo for PRs from forks

fields.description: I have added users to my repository, Is it possible to configure which user is watching which repository? If not this could be a great add on.
fields.summary: repository watchers (BB-16147)

fields.description:
It would be really helpful when builds can be triggered via the REST api.

This would make it possible to trigger deployments only during a specified maintainance window for example. I can imagine numerous other use cases for this.
fields.summary: REST API support for pipelines

fields.description:
I have multiple servers at digital ocean with Ubuntu and i what to authorise a public key so we we can deploy our application automatically without user and password.

Is any possibility to make like this? I don't want to store a user and a password on server and make a ssh connection.

Thx
fields.summary: Possibility to add SSH private key for deployment

fields.description:
Hi,

We are currently testing Pipelines. Great product!\\
When a build fails, how can we notify a group of persons? Are there any notification settings?

Thnx
fields.summary: HipChat notifications on broken tests/builds

fields.description: As a user I would like a documentation page with reference on all different expressions that can be used in an .hgignore file
fields.summary: Customer Request - As a user I would like a documentation page with reference on all different expressions that can be used in an .hgignore file (BB-16143)

fields.description:
set image to "tutum/lamp "

script:

* mysql  -uroot -e 'CREATE DATABASE {{foobar}}'

Result:\\
ERROR 2002 (HY000): Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)

Am I missing something? On my machine with docker it runs perfectly fine. I even built in a sleep to test if there are timing issues.
fields.summary: mysql does currently not work with pipelines

fields.description:
For larger projects it's common to have more than one build - eg. a fast one for smoke tests and early feedback, a slower one for a full integration test suite, another one for code quality tools. Their criteria are different and they can fail separately - different teams may own the results.

One way to do this would be to allow more than one yaml file; or have syntax inside the file to define different pipelines.
fields.summary: Allow multiple pipelines with separate results

fields.description: It would be great to have text area field instead of input for environment variable value. Because while setting large text (like SSH key, or config file) it becomes malformed and unreadable.
fields.summary: Text area for environment variable value

fields.description:
Use case seems common - we do all our work on branches, but we release _tags_... but pipelines does not run builds for tags.

So we have continuous delivery with tests running on everything except the actual deliverable :)

Obviously we don't release off broken branches, but there's still a chance something could go wrong while creating a tag. I'd rather have a confirmation build than just assume all is well.

I've raised a separate issue suggesting a feature to configure specific builds for tags vs. branches; but this one I'm raising as a bug as IMHO tags should be a build trigger.
fields.summary: Pipelines should run for tags as well as branches

fields.description:
Now official support doesn't contain any android-gradle template, so I did a little research. I use solution in the [link|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37557551/android-ci-using-bitbucket-pipelines-and-docker] , and run into the same problem.

Can you add a feature to build android-gradle project as easy as travis ci does?
fields.summary: Feature- Android-Gradle template support

fields.description:
Right now the pipelines page lists all builds in date order.

It would be nice to be able to sort the list by clicking on the table headers.

It would be even better to be able to filter the list, similar to the way to can on the Bitbucket Dashboard page. The most useful filter might be by branches. So if my bitbucket-pipelines.yml file contains the branches: master, feature/* and experimental/*, it would be great to be able to easily see just the builds from a particular branch.
fields.summary: Sorting and Filtering of the Pipelines page

fields.description:
We have a lot of repositories which all build and deploy code in the same general way. It would be great to be able to create Pipeline environment variables at the Team level and then be able to share them or reference them in the individual projects.

The challenge without this feature is key rotation. We change our builder credentials (i.e. AWS keys) on a regular basis. So having to go update 20+ repos individually is a pain.
fields.summary: Allow Pipeline environment variables to be created at the Team level

fields.description:
Since last Friday, nobody in our organization has received any email notifications from bitbucket (or hipchat either).  We suspected at first that they were being caught in our spam filter, as a team member changed their notifications to be sent to their gmail account and that worked, but our internal IT support has confirmed that the emails are not making it to us.

I found a support ticket here: BCLOUD-11376 which seems similar to our situation, and we were wondering if the problem could possibly be on your end.

As a note, we are still receiving JIRA and Confluence emails.
fields.summary: Not receiving any emails

fields.description:
If someone is using only Confluence cloud, our new fix using EasyConnect will not work: BCLOUD-9436

It would be nice to have another route to make the AppSwitcher pick up licenses for Bitbucket
fields.summary: Create AppSwitcher product links for those who only use Confluence

fields.description: when there are several environment variables defined in pipelines, sorting them by name will make them be easily maintained.
fields.summary: Sort pipelines environment variables by name

fields.description:
When publishing webpages using github pages, the response from the server does not uses compressed streams of data and only returns plain files.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/publishing-a-website-on-bitbucket-cloud-221449776.html

The issue BCLOUD-7663 has been marked as a bug but was closed for inactivity. Considering the fact that this could be a huge performance bottleneck I think that it should be re-opened.

BCLOUD-7663

This bug has not yet been fixed
fields.summary: gzip compression for bitbucket page
Markdown support for display of `readme.md` files does not support image sizing

fields.description:
The new pull request summary page is much better than before. The reviews are shown with their avatar and a small green tick if they have approved. Howver, there is no way to see on this overview if the author has approved.

Would it be possible to add the tick to the author avatar in the first column?
fields.summary: Show when when author has approved their own PR on pull request summary page

fields.description:
I deleted my bitbucket account which had a SSH key attached to it.

I now want to add the same SSH key to another user. It tells me it is already registered.

I want to attach that SSH key to another user.
fields.summary: Deleted bitbucket account, ssh key still attached

fields.description:
I want to host my repository at BitBucket and deploy via Pipelines on OpenShift at every push.

As OpenShift deployment is nothing else than _push_, I'm going to use OpenShift as _git remote_ repository.\\
also:\\
BitBucket Git Repo -> BitBucket Pipelines -> OpenShift Git Repo

To be able to do that I need certificate authentication.\\
Is there any way how I can:

* upload or create private/public keypair at BitBucket Pipelines
* install that in BitBucket Pipelines image (default)
* further I'll need to upload public key to OpenShift
fields.summary: Ability to add private/public key auth

fields.description:
Trying to delete this repository but it won't:

https://bitbucket.org/thebreakfastclub/yeggler-client
fields.summary: Repository won't delete

fields.description:
I just upgraded my SourceTree to Version 2.3.1 (69), and now when I am trying to push to my repo I get this 500 error:

Pushing to https://username@bitbucket.org/test_website/webiste.git\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://username@bitbucket.org/test_website/webiste.git': The requested URL returned error: 500

I was able to push yesterday with the older version, is there an easy way to roll back, is there a known issue with this SourceTree build
fields.summary: Unable to push to repo, 500 error
Unable to push to online-repo after bitbucket to Atlassian migration

fields.description:
Hi,

I get the below message when I push to my repo -

error: The requested URL returned error: 500 while accessing https://<user_name>@bitbucket.org/<user_name>/<repo-name>.git/info/refs

fatal: HTTP request failed

Please help.  Thanks.

Kamala
fields.summary: Git repo push failure.

fields.description:
I have been using Bitbucket for several years with no problems.

Today, if I try to push a git commit to any of my git repositories, I get the following error:

{code}
#!bash

git push
Counting objects: 16, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
Writing objects: 100% (4/4), 1.21 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 4 (delta 2), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: canceling statement due to conflict with recovery
remote: LINE 1: ...er"."date_joined" FROM "bb_repository" INNER JOIN "auth_user...
remote:                                                              ^
remote: DETAIL:  User was holding a relation lock for too long.
remote: 
To git@bitbucket.org:<org>/<repo>.git
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:<org>/<repo>.git'
{code}

Similarly, if I try to submit an online edit through the web interface, eg: by editing the readme file, I get a 500 internal server error, code\\
138782da7fcc476cb5aec98b6a07fb28.

This might be related to the switch to Atlassian user accounts? I use a Bitbucket account.

Obviously, this makes bitbucket pretty well unusable until this can be resolved.
fields.summary: Unable to push to bitbucket: pre-receive hook declined due to 'relation lock' in Bitbucket's DB

fields.description: I have already tried pulling and rebasing but no luck there. What is going on?
fields.summary: Cannot push code to repo - [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)

fields.description:
I am getting a 500 Internal Server Error whenever I push (either from SourceForge or the command line).

I've run a 'hg verify' on the repo and all seems fine:

repository uses revlog format 1\\
checking changesets\\
checking manifests\\
crosschecking files in changesets and manifests\\
checking files\\
4822 files, 950 changesets, 11102 total revisions

I've also checked the Operational Status Page and everything seems to be up.

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Getting 500 Internal Server Error on pushing

fields.description: It would be nice we are able to list the main branch for each repo in the repo listing API.
fields.summary: Missing main branch from repository listing APIs

fields.description:
When using Alpine Linux based docker container(e.g. golang:1.7beta1-alpine), will occur

{code}
docker: Error response from daemon: Container command '/bin/bash' not found or does not exist.
{code}

Because {{docker run}} command with {{--entrypoint=/bin/bash}}, but Alpine Linux have not {{/bin/bash}}.

Alpine Linux is a next standard based image. I think there is a need to support it.

Do you have any idea or fix plan?
fields.summary: Support for Alpine images (using /bin/sh) in Pipelines

fields.description: Using the Download page of a mercurial repository which contains subrepositiories just provides a download contaning the main repository and not the subrepositories.
fields.summary: Downloading repositories with subrepositories (Mercurial)

fields.description: Our team page (https://bitbucket.org/<team>/) keeps showing the call-to-action block ("Teams connect with HipChat!") in the right sidebar. After closing it (right upper corner) it dissapears.. only to be shown again on the next refresh.
fields.summary: Hide "Teams connect with HipChat!" once and for all

fields.description:
I am trying to pull a official Docker inside Docker image (the official Docker image) from DockerHub.  However it always fail during the "Build Setup" phase.

Here is the Pipelines def:

{code}
#!yaml

image: docker:1.9.1

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:  # Modify the commands below to build and test your repository.
          - docker run hello-world
{code}

Here is the log (I tried latest, latest-did, 1.9.1, 1.9.1-did, 1.10, 1.10-did... all failing):

{code}
#!sh

+ docker pull atlassian/agent-setup-git:latest

My purpose is to run "docker build" and the push the image to docker hub for deploy.

Is there a work around?  did anyone successfully get this done?  thanks!
fields.summary: Not able to setup the build environment for official Docker image

fields.description:
Hello,

here are the couple of packages that it'll be good to have in the default image:

* System tools: curl wget  unzip
* Selenium dependencies: xvfb  openjdk-7-jre-headless  chromium chromedriver git (maybe firefox and firefox driver as well)
* Database: PostgreSQL latest stable with PostGIS last stable

Maybe also Node.js latest stable

Together with caching it will greatly reduce building time, and taking into account that in one system multiple versions of Node.js and PostgreSQL/PostGIS versions can co-exist there should be no any problems.
fields.summary: Add essential packages to default image

fields.description:
Reproducible in Firefox. Not reproducible in Chrome.\\
Not sure about IE.

*Steps to reproduce:*

* Open a PR page and scroll down a bit ([example|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/tenant-provisioning/pull-requests/3/vpp-870-ensure-provisioning-event-listen/diff]).
* Refresh the page.

Check attached image for details.
fields.summary: Sidebar overlapping on refresh

fields.description:
Just logged in to notice that one of our builds was waiting for over 2 hours. A few other builds after this commit worked fine.

# global view of all pipelines in an account that are running/stopped/in progress
# settings to terminate build based on time

PS will this failed build minutes count against our account?

!3035617726-Pipelines%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket%202016-06-15%2011-55-39.jpg|thumbnail!!1831772724-Pipelines%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket%202016-06-15%2011-56-16.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Build stuck waiting for 2hours

fields.description:
Add example postgresql database use on a Rails project.\\
My try is https://bitbucket.org/jasnow/adopt-a-hydrant-ga-ccfes/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/%7Bc8b67bd6-d101-4d47-89c9-2dce63ef4d3c%7D

Thanks
fields.summary: Add example postgresql database use on a Rails project

fields.description:
In Bamboo, you can view a 'WallBoard' for all projects, giving you a nice overview of the build status (green/red) for each project. We use this in the office on a big screen, so that we have a nice overview of the various projects and their build status.

We would like to have something similar for Pipelines.
fields.summary: Wallboard for all repositories

fields.description:
Deploying to heroku is a key feature I'm looking for in a CI/CD service. I presume that that's an integration you have on your roadmap, but I didn't see any public issue / discussion of it, so here's a start?

Aside from the simple "deploy this revision to heroku app XXX" use cases (on each tested commit, or maybe only when a tag is bumped, etc), being able to configure things so that a new fork of a given heroku app is created and deployed to for each new branch would simplify things a lot.
fields.summary: Heroku deployment integration

fields.description: If a user co-purchases, then EasyConnects, they end up with duplicate links to JIRA.
fields.summary: Duplicate JIRA links created with EasyConnect (BB-16144)

fields.description:
Pipelines should auto pull and setup all submodules.

Currently private submodules will fail if manually running {{git submodule update --init --recursive}} under scripts. The error Im getting is {{Permission denied (publickey).}}.
fields.summary: Pipelines should update submodules when cloning

fields.description:
Right now it's only possible to see only the total time the build took.\\
Would be nice to show time for each individual step including build set up.
fields.summary: Show time for each command in pipeline

fields.description:
Hello I am unable to deploy to a normal FTP destination using maven docker image and piplines, Is the FTP protocol blocked?

Here is my config, If you need more info I will help where possible.

bitbucket-pipelines.yml

{code}
#!yaml
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        image: maven:3.3.3
        script:
          - mvn install -P unit-tests
  branches:
    develop:
      - step:
          image: maven:3.3.3
          script:
            - mvn --settings settings.xml deploy -P distribution,javadoc,source -X


{code}

settings.xml

{code}
#!xml
<settings>
    <servers>
        <server>
            <id>manticore</id>
            <username>${env.MANTICORE_USERNAME}</username>
            <password>${env.MANTICORE_PASSWORD}</password>
        </server>
    </servers>
</settings>


{code}

ERROR

{code}
#!text

[DEBUG] Using transporter WagonTransporter with priority -1.0 for ftp://manticore.co.za/public_html/repo
[DEBUG] Using connector BasicRepositoryConnector with priority 0.0 for ftp://manticore.co.za/public_html/repo with username=myusername, password=***
Downloading: ftp://manticore.co.za/public_html/repo/za/co/manticore/manticore/0.1.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
                                            
[WARNING] Could not transfer metadata za.co.manticore:manticore:0.1.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml from/to manticore (ftp://manticore.co.za/public_html/repo): Cannot login to remote system
org.eclipse.aether.transfer.MetadataTransferException: Could not transfer metadata za.co.manticore:manticore:0.1.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml from/to manticore (ftp://manticore.co.za/public_html/repo): Cannot login to remote system

fields.summary: Maven wagon-ftp deployment fail

fields.description:
We have a bunch of internal Mercurial repos that we service on our in-house build box, but we'd love to replace that with Pipelines ASAP.

Your FAQ says Mercurial support is in the works. Here's my +1, hoping support will arrive sooner rather than later.
fields.summary: Mercurial support in Pipelines

fields.description: We're still looking for ways to speed up our build, but in the mean time I'd like to get an overview of the build minutes we've already spent this month or the previous months. Where can I see that?
fields.summary: How can I see how many build minutes I have spent or have left in Pipelines?

fields.description:
Когда-то я удалил репозиторий https://bitbucket.org/miramir/dnb с редиректом на github, но теперь мне не нужна и эта ссылка.\\
Я попробовал использовать совет из статьи https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/how-do-i-remove-a-redirect-url-i-supplied-when-i-deleted-my-repo-282173855.html\\
и попытался создать репозиторий с таким же именем, но сервер мне отвечает что такой репозиторий уже есть.
fields.summary: I can`t delete repository

fields.description:
It will be great that Cloud REST APIs could provide the ability to check:

# which repository I have watched
# which repository I have watched and subscribed to notifications

Also by giving a specific repository, it is also great to be able to subscribe to notification to it using REST API.

Thanks
fields.summary: Repository watch and subscribed to notifications status

fields.description:
We use Pipelines to deploy to an IP-restricted AWS S3 bucket; and as such we need to whitelist the Pipelines agent IP addresses.

My devops team found that the documented Bitbucket IP addresses (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html) did not include Pipelines.

They found a workaround but it would be good to get the docs updated.
fields.summary: Document Pipeline agent IPs for network policies

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Repo avatars are not being updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Repository Settings page
# Click Change Avatar
# Select an Image and click Save
# Click Save repository details

h3. Expected Result
Repository Avatar should be updated

h3. Actual Result
A message is displayed that the repository avatar has been changed. However, the avatar is not actually updated.
fields.summary: Repo avatars are not being updated (BB-16137)

fields.description:
We do deployment of code from Bitbucket repository to different environments.

I think the following features are required in Bitbucket Pipelines when deploying:

# A flag which controls/triggers the deployment of code as soon as someone commit the code to branch. I do not want deployment to happen as soon as someone commits the code to the repo.
# Scheduling the deployment.
# A button click to trigger the deployment ( as it was in Bamboo cloud). I feel that this is the much required feature as we can do deployments whenever we need it.
fields.summary: Deployments using Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The problem cannot be consistently reproduced.

Some users are getting 500 errors when a) creating a Project b) Updating Project settings (e.g. after changing project avatar or project visibility)
fields.summary: Some users are getting 500 errors when creating a Project or Updating Project settings

fields.description:
tldr: please add triggers for...

* merging a branch
* deleting a branch
* pushing a tag
* deleting a tag

Details:

Currently (as far as I can tell) the only trigger for Pipelines is pushing or updating a branch. This is great for running tests, but not great if you need to deploy any artefacts that might need a cleanup.

In our use case, we push a set of test pages to an S3 bucket for peer and design review. When the branch is merged or deleted, we'd like to delete the deployed pages.

I'd also like to run different commands for tags vs branches; and I don't particularly want to rely on a naming scheme for that as it would be used for production deployments.
fields.summary: Trigger Pipelines when pushing tags and deleting branches/tags

fields.description: How can you setup different deploy process & environment values for each branch?
fields.summary: Separate pipeline per branch

fields.description: A demo configuration file and support for CI testing perl projects in pipelines would be cool
fields.summary: Perl Pipelines config

fields.description:
We would like to have an environment variable which contains the build number for the current branch. The build number should increment every time pipeline is executed.

This would allow us to create unique artifacts names, like we had in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Build number that increments on every build
old account

fields.description: When a repository is included within a project and the repository icon is not explicitly set, show the project icon as a default icon instead of the default language icon.
fields.summary: Default to Project Icon when Repository Icon is not set

fields.description:
* The Delete button snippet does not work when trying to delete a snippet if it's opened from the snippet link from the snippet tab on the user's Bitbucket profile
* 'Edit' and 'Delete' buttons disappear when opening an existing snippet from the snippet link and going to the revision tab

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Open a snippet from the snippet tab from the Bitbucket profile page
# Try deleting the snippet by clicking the delete button
# Go to 'Revisions' tab -> The 'Edit' and 'Delete' buttons are hidden

However, if a snippet is accessed from the snippets dropdown on top of the page... or after editing the snippet, the delete button works.

Refreshing the page on Source tab will work as well - Delete button will work again and the Edit/Delete button reappears
fields.summary: Snippets UI on the Bitbucket website seems to be broken (BB-16136)

fields.description: Currently from the Team Page you see a list of the Team's repos with heading Repository, Project and  Last Updated. It would be great to have the build status icon as well similar to when viewing a commit list.
fields.summary: Show build status of each repo on Team Page

fields.description:
* BB Cloud should have a similar support for branching models as BB Server: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-branches-in-bitbucket-server-776639968.html#UsingbranchesinBitbucketServer-Configuringthebranchingmodel
* When pushing "Create Branch" button on a JIRA Issue, it would be nice to configure the branch name to have a default prefix (like features/ as per gitflow).
fields.summary: Branching models for BB Cloud

fields.description:
!2841194036-Image.png|thumbnail!

The Web UI refuses to attach an SVG for a PR comment. I'd fine if it converted to a rasterised image, but for it to claim that "Only Images are Allowed" is less than helpful.
fields.summary: Attach SVG as PR comment image

fields.description: When there is a conflicting submodule, Bitbucket pops up an error message that says: {{Conflict: Submodule modifed in both source and destination}}. The word 'modifed' is misspelt and should be 'modified'.
fields.summary: A conflicting submodule error message has a misspelt word - 'modifed' should be 'modified'.

fields.description: Currently, we throw a 500 error if there is an e-mail in use on another account when trying to connect via Google auth.
fields.summary: Warn user of e-mail address in use before trying Google authentication (BB-16135)

fields.description: Currently, we are only showing the parent link of any single commit viewed on the Commits page, but it would be useful for reviewers to have a link to children presented chronologically (as in the list of commits) or present all children.
fields.summary: Create commit child links among the parent links under the "Commits" view page (BB-16134)

fields.description: Currently, you can see build times for individual builds. But it would be really handy to have a little dashboard where we have some info like build count, failed build count, successful build counts, total number of build minutes (since that might be billable to the user). It could be for the current period (billing?) or it could be fancier and allow a date range selection for the said stats.
fields.summary: A a user, I'd like to be able to see my team's aggregated build time for the current billing period

fields.description: Please add SAS to the programming language list.
fields.summary: Request to add SAS to the programming language list

fields.description: Please add the ability to select a webhook for pipeline build status (specifically for Slack integration) for notifications when a build succeeds, fails, etc.
fields.summary: Slack notification / web-hook for Pipelines

fields.description: If the {{npm test}} is missing, the step's log shows the warning, but the tests complete as successful.  It'd be great if the tool identified that, and threw a warning to the top level
fields.summary: Missing `npm test` still passes

fields.description: Would be great to have something similar to this https://semaphoreci.com/blog/2015/02/04/ssh-access-to-your-ci-environment.html
fields.summary: Allow SSH access into my Pipelines container

fields.description:
Mercurial strip task occasionally fails

*Workaround:*

Please open a support ticket here:\\
https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/bbs to request a changeset strip
fields.summary: Stripping changesets from Mercurial repos fails in some cases

fields.description:
It will be great if there is a small tooltip when hovering branch names while picking a branch from the branch dropdown ... when creating a pull request.

Currently, when creating a pull request, the branch names of the top right (from branch) are truncated If branches names are long with a slight difference at the end of the branch name. Therefore it's quite a trouble to know which branch one merging from.

!3358926786-Screen%20Shot%202016-06-09%20at%204.02.17%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Request: Small tooltip when hovering long branch names when creating pull requests.

fields.description:
Hi.

I think the option to enable a pipeline to run sequentially (one at a time per pipeline / branch, ordered by the commit date) would be very useful.

That would be useful (essential, even) in cases where one commit results in one deploy.

The way it is today, you can't commit multiple times in a short period of time, or it will result in multiple deploys running at the same time.

The configuration could be like this:

{code}
#!yml
image: MY_IMAGE
pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      sequential: true
      - step:
          script:
            - MY_SCRIPT
{code}

or

{code}
#!yml
image: MY_IMAGE
pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      parallel: false
      - step:
          script:
            - MY_SCRIPT
{code}

Thanks.
fields.summary: Limit concurrent pipelines so deployment scripts don't clash

fields.description:
I was trying to log in with a Google account. After the OAuth process, it requests that I add a user name. Then I get the attached error.  The next time I try to log in it requests that I add a user name again but it says my username is taken.  The original error ID is

66accb5b316d43f0bd6dcf4e615a8ba9

Although I have already tried with several user names :'((
fields.summary: I cannot create an account
Cannot Delete Repository.

fields.description: Is there a way of storing dependencies (in my case python packages) between builds à la travis? (https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/caching/). Or if not is there any other similar way to speed up the builds?
fields.summary: Caching dependencies in Pipelines

fields.description: my repo https://jeevansirela@bitbucket.org/jeevansirela/vler.git crossed 2GB , so i reduced its size to 138 MB but can't push it. It says its in read only mode can't push it. What to do?
fields.summary: Repo crossed 2GB Hard limit

fields.description: Is there some example available of how to deploy to FTP?
fields.summary: Deploy-to-FTP Pipeline

fields.description:
Hi,

When navigating between repositories, I use the "Dashboard" "Overview". It shows 25 repositories per page, which means I have to navigate between page 1 and page 2 to access all my repositories. This feels very unnecessary, the page seems to have plenty of space to list all my repositories.

Would like to see all repositories listed in the same page, or at least a "repositories per page" selector.
fields.summary: Dashboard overview shows too few repositories, should show all in one page

fields.description: I am trying to clone my repo on a windows system. But i am not able to do that. Please find attached screenshot for error message and further reference.
fields.summary: Not able to clone my repo

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

*1* Have as many Projects as possible to have a second page in this overview:

* https://bitbucket.org/your_user_name/profile/projects

*2* Click on 2 at the bottom to go to the next page.

*3* You'll notice that licking on the link to page 2 goes to this page instead:

* https://bitbucket.org/account/projects/?page=2

It should go to:

* https://bitbucket.org/your_user_name/profile/projects?page=2

Workaround: Manually edit the URL to the correct one works.
fields.summary: URL set for the second page of the Projects overview is wrong. (BB-16124)

fields.description: Will be better if milestone & version have description. It will help project manager clarifies roadmap.
fields.summary: Milestone & Version description

fields.description:
I edited the environment variables, but that didn't trigger a build, so I have to manually edit a file so I can see if my build works now.

This might also be needed if my project has some external dependency, the status of which has changed.
fields.summary: Manual trigger to build a branch or commit

fields.description:
Seen in a tweet: https://twitter.com/loicmathaud/status/740104095382548480

In a PHPUnit test we can see some tests failing in the logs but the pipeline is marked as passed.
fields.summary: Pipeline with PHPUnit fails with str_repeat() error and passes anyway

fields.description:
At the moment developers are supposed to use one of the add-on contexts in the descriptor: account or individual. It determines whether the add-on can be installed either in a team account or in a personal account.

We have 2 add-ons for Bitbucket Cloud, Awesome Graphs and File Viewer. And we need to make them available for both types of accounts.

Each of them has one add-on key with the individual context at the moment.

For File Viewer we also made a descriptor with the 'account' context to make it possible to install the add-on in a team account by inserting the descriptor URL on the 'Custom add-ons' page in the Team settings.

But this workaround is not a good solution. Because users first try installing the add-on by selecting it in the listing of available add-ons in Bitbucket Cloud and realize it doesn't work for teams. To get it to work, they are supposed to contact us and get the descriptor URL.

We'd like to make it possible for users to install our add-ons both in individual and team accounts by adding them in the 'Find integrations and add-ons' section in Bitbucket Cloud settings without inserting the descriptor URL.

It is not a problem to make 2 versions of the same add-on (one with account context, and the other with individual). Can Bitbucket be checking the type of the account a user is using to access the listing of add-ons in settings and based on that display the relevant version of the add-on?
fields.summary: Make add-on available for both team and individual Bitbucket accounts

fields.description:
We'd like to be able to receive events in Bitbucket Cloud when the state of sidebar changes, e.g. in Bitbucket Server there are the following events for that 'bitbucket.internal.feature.sidebar.collapseEnd', 'bitbucket.internal.feature.sidebar.expandEnd'

We need that to update our graphs ([Awesome Graphs|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/bitbucket-graphs/cloud/overview]) based on the changed size of the area they can take on the page
fields.summary: Sidebar events

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Each team account has its own integrations/add-ons. Users sometimes remove an add-on from their individual account, but don't realize they need to remove it from a team as well, so that it doesn't show up on their team repos.

h3. Suggested Solution
Manage team add-ons in the individual account's add-ons section. Suggested mock-up by customer:

!2677646351-bitbucket_integrations_management_page_mockup.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user I want to manage my team integrations in my individual account integrations page - Customer request
